name: Belgian Strong Dark Ale
description: I want to put my new Maelstrom stir plate to the test so I want to make a big beer. What better big beer than a strong Belgian.

yeast: 1 package WLP545 Belgian Strong Ale Yeast

brewing_instructions: Heat 5 gallons of strike water to 161°F
Add 5 gallons of water to the mash tun
Add all grains to mash tun and confirm temperature of 148°F
Steep grains for 60 minutes
While steeping, heat 3.5 gallons of water to 170°F for lautering
Extract first runnings into boil kettle
Add 3.5 gallons water and wait 15 minutes
Extract second runnings into boil kettle
Total wort volume should be 6.5 gallons
Bring water to a boil and wait for the hot break
Begin boil
At 0 minutes add 15 drops FermCap to reduce foaming
At 0 minutes, add 1.5 oz Hallertau hops
At 45 minutes add 1 lb candi sugar
At 45 minutes add 1 lb table sugar
At 50 minutes, add 2.5 oz Hallertau hops
At 50 minutes, add one tablet Whirlfloc
At 50 minutes, add 1/2 tsp yeast nutrient
At 60 minutes, chill the wort to approx. 65°F
Aerate with pure oxygen for 1 minute
Move to the primary fermenter
Pitch yeast from yeast starter
Ferment at 68°F
At 6 days, raise fermentation temperature to 72°F
At 10 days, lower the temperature to 69°F
At 13 days, cold crash to 35°F
At 15 days, keg beer
starter_brewing_instructions: Boil 7 oz DME in 2 L of water for 10 minutes
tasting_notes: The beer came out great! Good color, very dry and warming alcohol but not over the top. It has good Belgian flavor and could have used something a little more spicy. I am not sure what but all in all the beer came out very good!
